info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 8:40PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN INDIANA...EAST CENTRAL BUTLER...JEFFERSON...CENTRAL ARMSTRONG AND SOUTHEASTERN CLARION COUNTIES THROUGH 930 PM EDT... At 840 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Marienville to near Brookville to 6 miles northeast of Shanor-Northvue. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Punxsutawney, Kittanning, Brookville, Rimersburg, Reynoldsville, Brockway, New Bethlehem, West Kittanning, Clymer, Sykesville, Chicora, and Falls Creek. This includes Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 75 and 96. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
